subject: Re: [junit] how to test private methods
msgSnippet: You probably want to execute the method against the instance variable (contactinfoscrambler), not the class (c). Also, since I ask this at least once a
messageBody:
You probably want to execute the method against the instance variable
(contactinfoscrambler), not the class (c).

Also, since I ask this at least once a month--are you sure that this
couldn't be a public method, perhaps on FilteredRowSet?

David Saff

pokala_rajeswar wrote:
> Hi,
> I am testing java programs using JUnit fraewotk. In part of my job I
> am getting the problems with testing private methods.
> I am not using SuiteRunner tool. When I am testing private method in
> JUnit using PrivilegedAccessor class, some times I am getting the
> problem like NoSuchMethodException and sometimes getting NullPointer
> Exception. my program code is below.
> can u please help me how to write the JUnit testcase
>
> MyActual code
>
> private String getRandomString(String column, FilteredRowSet rs,
> Integer min,
> Integer max) throws Exception {
> int currentRecord;
> String columnData = null;
> currentRecord = rs.getRow();
> do {
> // rs.absolute(generateRandomNumberBetweenRange(
> min, max));
> columnData = rs.getString(column);
> } while (columnData == null || columnData.trim()
> == "");
> rs.absolute(currentRecord);
>
> return columnData;
> }
>
> I have testcase for this code:
>
> public void testGetRandomString(){
>
> try{
> frs.setCommand("select * from CONTACT_INFOS");
> frs.execute();
> frs.last();
> int maximum_rec = frs.getRow();
> contactinfoscrambler = new
> ContactInfoScrambler();
> Class c = ContactInfoScrambler.class;
>
>
> String column="FIRST_NAME";
> int minimum = 1;
>
> // Class[] classTypes=
> {String.class,javax.sql.rowset.FilteredRowSet.class,java.lang.Integer.
> class,java.lang.Integer.class};
> Object[] arg ={new String(),new
> FilteredRowSetImpl(),new java.lang.Integer(1),new java.lang.Integer
> (1)};
> Object rt=null;
>
> if(c!=null)
> {
> System.out.println("
> from : "+c.getName());
> rt=PrivilegedAccessor.invokeMethod(
> c,"getRandomString",arg );
> }
> System.out.println("Success");
> String data=(String)rt;
> System.out.println("value : "+rt);
> System.out.println("value : "+data);
>
> assertNotNull(rt);
> }
> catch(Exception e){
> e.printStackTrace();
> }
>
> output of testcase:
>
> java.lang.NullPointerException
> at prevaccr.PrivilegedAccessor.getMethod
> (PrivilegedAccessor.java:111)
> at prevaccr.PrivilegedAccessor.getMethod
> (PrivilegedAccessor.java:125)
> at prevaccr.PrivilegedAccessor.getMethod
> (PrivilegedAccessor.java:125)
> at prevaccr.PrivilegedAccessor.invokeMethod
> (PrivilegedAccessor.java:71)
> at
> com.npssoft.pointspree.dbexpimp.ContactInfoScramblerTest.testGetRandom
> String(ContactInfoScramblerTest.java:106)
> at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
> at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
> (NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:85)
> at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
> (NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:58)
> at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
> (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:60)
> at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:391)
> at junit.framework.TestCase.runTest(TestCase.java:154)
> at junit.framework.TestCase.runBare(TestCase.java:127)
> at junit.framework.TestResult$1.protect(TestResult.java:106)
> at junit.framework.TestResult.runProtected
> (TestResult.java:124)
> at junit.framework.TestResult.run(TestResult.java:109)
> at junit.framework.TestCase.run(TestCase.java:118)
> at junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest(TestSuite.java:208)
> at junit.framework.TestSuite.run(TestSuite.java:203)
> at
> org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.runTests
> (RemoteTestRunner.java:421)
> at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.run
> (RemoteTestRunner.java:305)
> at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.main
> (RemoteTestRunner.java:186)
>
>
